result.execSummary:
The defendant Keyjuan Lavell Henry was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Drive or Operate Vehicle w/o Consent, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.23(3).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: SENTENCE IN CASE 15CF3160 BUT CONSECUTIVE TO ANY OTHER SENTENCE.

miscConds.notes:
Defendant ordered to submit DNA sample if not already done.
Pay all costs and surcharges, including the mandatory DNA surcharge, by DOC out of up to 25% of any applicable prison funds. To be paid by the end of probation.  If not paid, a civil judgment to be entered.

Seek and maintain full time employment.
Obtain high school diploma or GED.

Defendant advised that he may never again possess firearms or weapons.
Civil rights suspended until reinstated.

No contact with drug community.
No contact with victims: Christopher B. and Christina W.

Court finds the defendant was under the age of 25 at the time of the offense, the charge is a Class H/I felony or misdemeanor, society would not be harmed and the defendant would benefit by expungement.  Upon successful completion of the sentence, defendant may apply for expungement.

Mental health assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.
Cognitive Behavior Therapy.

Alcohol and drug assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.
Absolute sobriety.
Random urine screens.  No positive results.
No illegal drugs.
No controlled substances without valid prescription.

charges.descr: Drive or Operate Vehicle w/o Consent

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Keyjuan Lavell Henry

records.addlTxt: Received & Filed, Original SENTENCING HEARING  Transcript (38 pages) commencing 11-02-2015 by DANIELLE LANSER.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Keyjuan Lavell Henry in court with attorney Mary Garvin Guimont.  Defendant Keyjuan Lavell Henry in custody.  Joanne L Hardtke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.


AS TO COUNT 1:
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty. Judgment of conviction entered.  Firearms warning given.  Voting admonishment given.  DNA notification given.    

 State has complied with victim notification.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, Defense, and Defendant.  

SENTENCE IS CONCURRENT TO SENTENCE IN CASE 15CF3160 BUT CONSECUTIVE TO ANY OTHER SENTENCE.

The Court sentenced the defendant to a TOTAL LENGTH of imprisonment of 42 months.
The INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons is 18 months with credit for 119 days time served.
The Court orders the defendant to serve a maximum term of EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 24 months.

The court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation for a period of 3 years.

Conditions of Probation/Extended Supervision to be determined by the Dept. of Corrections, but to include:

*
*Mental health assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.
*Alcohol and drug assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.
*Absolute sobriety.
*Random urine screens.  No positive results.
*No illegal drugs.
*No controlled substances without valid prescription.
*No contact with drug community.
*No contact with victims: Christopher B. and Christina W.
*Seek and maintain full time employment.
*Obtain high school diploma or GED.
*Cognitive Behavior Therapy.

- Defendant ordered to submit DNA sample if not already done.
- Defendant advised that he may never again possess firearms or weapons.
- Civil rights suspended until reinstated.  Order received and filed.
- Pay all costs and surcharges, including the mandatory DNA surcharge, by DOC out of up to 25% of any applicable prison funds. To be paid by the end of probation.  If not paid, a civil judgment to be entered.
- Defendant does qualify for the Challenge Incarceration Program and the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.

Appeal rights given.  Court finds the defendant was under the age of 25 at the time of the offense, the charge is a Class H/I felony or misdemeanor, society would not be harmed and the defendant would benefit by expungement.  Upon successful completion of the sentence, defendant may apply for expungement.   

- Received and filed:  Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence; Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief; Pretrial Incarceration Credit.

Attorney Mary Garvin Guimont in court, defendant Keyjuan Lavell Henry not in court, in custody.  Joanne L Hardtke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case calendared for projected guilty plea and sentencing hearing.  Defendant has new charges.  Defense counsel requests new date.    Case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 26.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 2, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Mary Garvin Guimont in court, defendant Keyjuan Lavell Henry not in court, in custody.  Joanne L Hardtke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense counsel requests projected guilty plea and sentencing hearing.  Case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 26.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 1, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Scheduling conference on August 20, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed.  Court consented to substitution against Judge Conen.  Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Judge William Pocan, Br. 26.

- NO FILE IN COURT -
Attorney Vincent Guimont for Attormey Mary Garvin Guimont in court, defendant Keyjuan Lavell Henry not in court, in custody.  Timothy J. Cotter for Joanne Hardtke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

**Court administratively ordered the outstanding bench warrant WITHDRAWN.

Court addressed bail:  Court ordered bail set at $1,000.00 cash with TURNOVER TO:  Justice Point Pretrial Services for supervision.  Conditions of release:  (1) Maintain absolute sobriety.  (2) Submit to random urine screens.  (3) No contact with the victim.

  ALL PARTIES ARE NOTIFIED AS OF AUGUST 1, 2015, THIS CASE WILL BE REASSIGNED TO JUDGE JEFFREY CONEN, BRANCH 30, IN ROOM 635 OF THE COURTHOUSE, DUE TO JUDICIAL ROTATION.

Case adjourned to 08-20-2015 at 1:30 PM - Br. 30, Judge Conen's Court for Scheduling Conference.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE JUDGE ON RETURN OF THE BENCH WARRANT.

Atty. Mary Guimont appeared in court on behalf of the defendant prior to the case being called on the record.  Defendant Keyjuan Lavell Henry not in court.  Joanne L Hardtke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Parties unable to proceed with a scheduling conference today.
Defendant does NOT appear.
Court ordered a bench warrant to issue.
  COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE JUDGE ON RETURN OF THE BENCH WARRANT.

**No bail forfeited.

Defendant Keyjuan Lavell Henry in court in person.  Attorney Mary Garvin Guimont appeared TELEPHONICALLY on behalf of the defendant.  Joanne L Hardtke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Defense is awaiting an offer from the State.
  Stipulated request for adjournment received and filed.
Case adjourned to 06-30-2015 at 8:30 AM - Br. 2, Judge Donald's Court for Adjourned Scheduling Conference.

Defendant Keyjuan Lavell Henry in court with attorney Mary Garvin Guimont.  Defendant Keyjuan Lavell Henry in custody.  Nathaniel Adamson for Joanne L Hardtke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Donald, Branch 02.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference to Branch 02.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 4, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Produce and return juvenile, Keyjuan Henry, from Vel R. Phillips Juvenile Justice Center Detention to Criminal Justice Facility Preliminary Court for hearing on 05/21/2015; faxed and filed.  bes

Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with CHRISTOPHER B.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Keyjuan Lavell Henry in court with attorney Francisco Araiza.  Defendant Keyjuan Lavell Henry in custody.  
Ronald Dague appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Donald, Branch 02.  
Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  
Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 21, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
